page.title: 10Farming, General
page.content: This area has good fertile soil, and farming is the dominant industry. Mixed farming is practised, including dairy and beef cattle, sheep, arable crops and fruit. Farmers aim to produce milk and meat economically by using home-grown feed i.e.silage and barley. Wheat is grown for sale off the farm. Friesians are the main dairy breed. The EEC has imposed milk quotas because of over-production. The main beef breed is the Hereford, with one pedigree herd in the block. The Hereford/Friesian cross is also popular for its ability to fatten off grass. Sheep from Welsh hill farms are brought into the area to over-winter on specially grown rape and turnips. Mechanisation of farming operations since l950 has reduced the number of farm workers but greatly increased the capital input of farming.
